basics.name: Inge Gatovsky©
basics.label: Cloud Engineer
basics.summary: is a dedicated student pursuing a degree in Systems Engineering from Mexico. Python is his favorite language and which he masters best, he performs optimally in the use of technologies such as Docker, Pulumi SDK, Bash and K8S integrated with AWS cloud services. He's passionate about Machine Learning and Linux systems, always eager to learn new skills and technologies.

about.title: Professional Background
about.content: He is a cloud engineer with experience in developing cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python. He has a solid foundation in Python and is proficient in Docker, Bash and Kubernetes. He's an expert in AWS cloud services including VPC, EC2, EKS, ALB, IAM, Lambda, API Gateway and S3.

about.title: Achievements
about.content: He has achieved several awards and recognitions, including 1st place in the Competitive Programming contest at ITCancun in 2023 and 3rd place in the Genius Arena - Jalisco Talent Land 2024. He has also taken several courses in Python, Docker and Data Science, obtaining certifications from IBM, Cisco and the University of Michigan.

about.title: Career Goals
about.content: He's seeking a challenging position as a Cloud Engineer where can leverage his skills and experience to develop innovative cloud solutions. An passionate about technology and committed to continuous learning and professional development.

experience.summary: As a Cloud Engineer were wrote modules to deploy resources in the AWS cloud. Some of the tasks performed were testing code made by other teammates and integrating them into the repository.
highlights: Automated development environments using Docker and Bash, enhancing efficiency for developers.
Deployed APIs utilizing API Gateway and AWS Lambda to streamline application performance.
Refactored code and integrated updates into the project repository to improve codebase maintainability.
Resolved Git conflicts to facilitate smooth collaboration and version control.
Reviewed and approved pull requests, ensuring adherence to coding standards and project requirements.

experience.summary: As a Python developer were designed cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python, also identified and implemented process improvements to improve system performance and efficiency.
highlights: Developed cloud infrastructure modules using the Pulumi SDK with Python, including VPC, EC2, EKS, ALB, IAM, and S3 services.
Identified and implemented process improvements to enhance system performance and efficiency.
Developed and maintained repository documentation to ensure clear communication and alignment within the team.
Competitive Programing - ITCancún 2023 – 1st place - Internal competitive programming contest at ITCancún, where exceptional team collaboration and problem solving were demonstrated.
Competitive Programing - ITCancún 2022 - 7th place - Participated in individual programming contest at ITCancún, where problem solving were demonstrated.

awards.title: Hackathon – Jalisco Talent Land 2024 – 3rd place
awards.summary: As part of the SISA track: Anomaly detection by traffic analysis in navigation, He led the Redeemed Guys team in the SiSaGuard project.

awards.title: Speaker – Jalisco Talent Land 2024 – Developer Land
awards.summary: Talk “Simplify and regulate your development processes in the cloud” as part of the promotion of the Archie by cloudbuddies platform.

courses.title: Python for AI and Web Dev.

projects.name: AWS Crud Component
projects.subname: Used AWS CDK to develop a CRUD web app
projects.author: Inge Gatovsky
projects.description: Internal component used by Archie to store and retrieve data on DynamoDB tables...
projects.content: This project is a CRUD application that uses AWS CDK and NextJS to store and retrieve data on DynamoDB. Currently used as a local component for Archie developers side. Based on the public project's Sankharr repository. Modifications and Enhancements:
features: Allows you to choose the name of the table to be created.
Allows you to select the name of the table to which data will be appended.
When you finish entering data, you are correctly redirected to the table you worked on.
Allows you to delete items correctly When editing an element of the table.
Now recover the data from it to avoid having to write all the fields again

projects.name: Emotion Analyzer
projects.subname: API Call for IBM Watson NLU service
projects.author: Inge Gatovsky
projects.description: FastAPI and Next.js technologies to create a web application to analyze...
projects.content: Emotion Analyzer combines FastAPI and Next.js technologies to create a web application to analyze emotions in texts using IBM Watson NLU. The results of the analysis are described in a dashboard with the key parts of the analysis. It is designed to offer a smooth user experience and provide an analysis of sentiments, entities and dominant emotions in the provided text in a short time.
features: Implemented with FastAPI, known for its high performance and ease of use.
Developed with Next.js to offer fast and efficient navigation.
It presents the results of the analysis in a clear and understandable way using interactive graphics.
Supports input validation to ensure that texts are within the allowed range.
Protection against DDoS attacks by protecting API calls for a time limit.

projects.name: Jinicuil
projects.subname: Maintenance of the Jinicuil Consultoría Digital
projects.author: Inge Gatovsky
projects.description: Maintenance of the Jinicuil Consultoría Digital  website. Focused on using Bootstrap & JS...
projects.content: Jinicuil Consultoría Digital is a website focused on providing Fortinent services. The project was focused on the maintenance of the website, updating the information and the design of the website. The website was built using Bootstrap and JavaScript.
features: Update the information of the website
Update the design of the website
Update the images of the website
